_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:38:53 using v2.7
title: How many patients are affected by delayed transfers (by the type of care they received)?
analysis_commentary: The overall pattern seen in the number of patients experiencing a delayed transfer of care is not replicated across both types of care patients received. While there is a 24 per cent increase in the number of patients who received acute care with a similar pattern to the total number of patients this is not the case for patients who received non-acute care. Over the same period when receiving non-acute care the number of patients who had a delayed transfer of care decreased from 2,381 patients in August 2010 to 1,843 in December 2015 (a 23 per cent decrease).
